meanings.definition: Relating to time or limited by time.
meanings.sent1: The temporals nature of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent2: She carefully studied the temporals aspects of the clock, noting each tick and tock.
meanings.sent3: The temporals constraints of the deadline loomed over the team, urging them to work efficiently.
meanings.sent4: His temporals existence seemed to fade away as he lost himself in the timeless melody of the music.
meanings.sent5: The temporals rhythm of the seasons guided the cycle of growth and change in the forest.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to worldly affairs or secular concerns.
meanings.sent1: The king's temporals power extended over the governance of the land.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to focus on the temporals matters of finance rather than abstract theories.
meanings.sent3: The temporals duties of daily life kept him grounded amidst the chaos of the world.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, his temporals ambitions seemed insignificant compared to the vast universe.
meanings.sent5: Her temporals possessions were few, but each held sentimental value in her heart.
